name: Wireless Services
description: Sector template for wireless network services patents including location services, messaging, VoIP, and mobile application services.
contextDescription: Wireless services patents cover the higher-layer services delivered over wireless networks. Key areas include location-based services (LBS), messaging (SMS, RCS), voice over LTE (VoLTE), push notifications, and mobile application enablement. Targets include mobile operators, OTT service providers, and mobile platform vendors.
scoringGuidance: Location-based services patents are high value as indoor positioning becomes mainstream.
VoLTE/VoNR patents are relevant as voice transitions to IP-based delivery.
RCS messaging patents target operator messaging modernization.
Emergency services (E911, eCall) patents have regulatory compliance value.
Patents enabling new service models (network slicing, edge services) are strategically valuable.

questions.question: What type of wireless service does this patent address? Consider: location/LBS, voice/VoLTE, messaging/RCS, push notifications, or emerging services.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify service category: location, voice, messaging, data, emergency, value-added.

questions.question: How dependent is this service on network infrastructure? Score 1-3 for device-only, 4-6 for basic network support, 7-10 for deep network integration (IMS, MEC, slicing).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Network-integrated services target operators. Device-centric target OEMs.

questions.question: How does this patent improve user experience? Score 1-3 for infrastructure-focused, 4-6 for indirect UX improvement, 7-10 for direct/significant UX enhancement.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess user-facing improvements: latency, quality, reliability, new capabilities.

questions.question: Is this patent relevant to location-based services? Score 1-3 if not applicable, 4-6 for basic location, 7-10 for advanced LBS (indoor, high-accuracy, proximity).
questions.reasoningPrompt: LBS enables navigation, geofencing, asset tracking, and proximity marketing.

questions.question: Is this patent relevant to mobile network operators? Score 1-3 for OTT/device-only, 4-6 for operator-optional, 7-10 for operator-essential (VoLTE, IMS, RCS).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Operator-essential patents enable licensing to carriers. Assess operator dependency.
